definition: to pray to Buddha/to chant the names of Buddha

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
Buddha/Buddhism
to count one's prayer beads and chant Buddha's name (idiom)
to recite or chant Buddhist scripture
to chant the sutras
one of the many names of Buddha
to vow
to give food (as a charity)/"feeding the hungry ghosts" (Buddhist ceremony)
to be reborn/to live in paradise (Buddhism)/to die/(after) one's death
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
Dana (Buddhist practice of giving)
Amitabha Buddha/the Buddha of the Western paradise/may the lord Buddha preserve us!/merciful Buddha!
Kṣitigarbha Bodhisattva, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
Healing sutra/Bhaisajyaguru sutra
to instruct (novices)/to preach/to teach/to reveal
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
karmic hindrance (buddhism)/karmic consequences that stand in the way of enlightenment/(term of abuse, especially toward the younger generation) devil spawn/(fig.) money
Bodhisattva (Buddhism)
